dialogues.Roque:

[18]

[31]I can't take much more of this.

[33]Due respect, you're nobody's Colonel anymore.

[49]

[76]I want my life back! This is supposed to be us getting clear - not saving the world! 
[77]

[103]So figure out a way around them; you're good at that shit, Clay! 
[104]We run now, we're gonna be running forever. This is our one chance to get our lives back... To steal them back. And I'm prepared to do anything to any one to make that happen.

[114]After the truck. I got tired of waiting for you to save us, so I up and saved myself. Reached out like I said and cut a deal - I set this up, I go free. 
[115]You gave me no choice. It was always gonna end like this, Clay. Us captured or dead. It was always a dead end. You made sure of it. 
[116]Not bullshit. You were gonna keep planning missions and ways to hit Max until it got us all killed. 
[117]Yes, Clay. Yes. Only difference with this situation is at least I get to walk away. 
[118]Don't you get it yet? There is no drive. There never was... 
[119]Fennel made it up to save himself. When I told Wade, he planted the info at Goliath to lead you here. 
[120]You really thought there was a happy ending coming? Pooch was gonna get his family back, we were gonna get to be soldiers again?  We lost the moment we went off mission. This is just the logical conclusion of that playing out. You didn't want to hear it. 103. 
[121]You just wanted your revenge. Your face-to-face with the big bad wolf. I'm sorry, buddy, but it's the way of the world... 
[122]Guys like us don't beat guys like him. 
[123]Wait.

[128]

[135]Now I really am gonna cut your head off...

dialogues.Pooch:

[60]When we first went over in 2001, Jolene and my oldest Tina wanted to do the yellow ribbon thing, right? Only problem was there was no yellow ribbon to be found - all the stores had been cleaned out.

And when she's all done, Tina, four years old, looks my wife dead in her eye and says "that's the dumbest song I ever heard." So my wife and my four year old ended up tying a frilly purple ribbon round the old oak tree in our yard to bring Daddy home... 86. 
[62]Yeah...

dialogues.Max:
[1]Well, that was stupid. 
[2]Very stupid, Colonel... Franklin... Clay. 
[3]And you think I didn't know that? Not the sharpest of knives in the drawer, are you? We locked coordinates the moment you painted; delivery will occur on schedule. Max out. 
[4]Understood, Cobra One. Kill Bandit. 
[5]And again. 
[6]Tell me - is this a moral issue or a financial issue? 
[7] 
[8]Okay, here's what I'm hearing. I'm hearing "No." I'm hearing "Leave," and I'm hearing "I'm sorry." Is that what I'm hearing? 
[9]Right. Okay, so that is what I'm hearing. Now, I want you to listen. Listen carefully because I want you to hear this. Wade? 32. 
[10]What the hell was that? 
[11]A "hit him in the face" nod, not a "throw him out the window" nod. 
[12]At most--at most that was a "break his fingers" nod.  I mean Jesus, Wade, the man was scientific genius. Granted his weight signaled that he had certain impulse control issues, but that's no reason to throw his fat ass out a fifty story window. 
[13] I think I speak for everyone here when I say that your actions were excessive and, yes, more than just a little wasteful... 
[14]...then again, it seemed to have had the desired effect - toss Short Round out next. 33. 
[15]The hell you say. I need one to test and one to use. 
[16]Of course one to test - you think I trust you? 
[17]You will have much money. 
[18]Call our people at Goliath, tell them we'll have a special package arriving on the 17th. 
[19]It used to be so simple. A post 9/11 world... 39. 
[20]As a country we spoke with one voice, moved with one purpose. We had a wicked boner for doing the right thing, and now look at us! 
[21]90 percent of the globe is tooling up to whack us and we're too busy losing our nerve to notice. It's Us versus Them and right now my money would be on them... 
[22]Wasn't it Thomas Jefferson who once said the tree of freedom must be watered with etcetera, etcetera? We need to wake people up, Wade. We need to hit them in the face, angry up the blood, give them their balls back. 
[23]We need to give them a ten megaton reality check.  Boom Boom Boom Boom... 40. 
[24]I think it's safe to say it works! 
[25]Jeez, talk about hard to impress... 
[26]Kinda... Sorta... 
[27]You know the drill, they don't like to know how the sausages get made. What do you care? 
[28]The money's coming from our Afghanistan operation. And what the Company doesn't know won't hurt them. 
[29]We're gonna saving our country, Wade. The United States of America will benefit greatly from what we're doing. 
[30]Jesus, fine - we're saving North America, does that make you happy? Just get it done. 
[31]Wonderful guy, salt of the earth, he'll be missed--who took my bomb, Wade? 
[32]Because I've been such a fan of how things have gone up till now? 
[33]Who the hell are these people? 
[34]I also had several African nations overthrown three years ago, I'm a 
[35]Shit. 
[36]Okay, they need to get dead. Get me a six man fire team ready in twelve hours. 68. 
[37]What's the plan? The plan is - get me a six man fire team ready in twelve hours. 
[38]Are we now clear on the plan or do you want to try a third go-around? 
[39]Because what I'm going to need you to do is get me a six man fire team ready in twelve hours. You get that, right? 
[40]And Wade? 
[41]We're gonna need a new bomb. 
[42]That's a lot of a paper routes... 
[43]Not even close. 
[44]Won't give it to us willingly... You get that six man team together like I asked? 
[45]Change of plans. Kill them. 
[46]Or fire them, whichever's easier. 
[47]Fine, fine, I'm not a detail guy. What I need- wait. Did you give them intel on Clay's people? 
[48]Aaaand we're back to killing them. 
[49]Touchy, touchy. Jeez, what are you related to them? 
[50]By blood? 
[51]It's not what we're doing, it's what Clay is going to do for us... 
[52] 
[53]By your boys? 
[54] 
[55]   Why, Mr. Wade... methinks you have a secret. Okay. Put a fire team together. 
[56]So? 91. 
[57] We know exactly where they're going, Wade. Port of New York, for their big final awesome stand against the forces of evil where they die. 
[58]Jesus, always with the money! So impersonal! How are you? How have you been? 
[59]Can't complain. I'm thinking of getting satellite radio in my car... 
[60]Hey, I'm all about the bombs, baby. 
[61]Time to go make a withdrawal... 92. 
[62]I've got to go get your money. 
[63]God, are you short. 
[64]Get it done. 
[65]How much do you weigh? Seriously. 
[66]Where the hell is my bomb? 
[67]For a guy who's all about transcending materialism, you talk about money so much! 93. 
[68]Fine... 
[69]We good? 
[70]Who is this? 
[71]Where's Wade? 
[72]Clay. 
[73]Colonel, yes. Well done. 
[74]I understand you've always wanted to meet face to face. I'm sure that could be arranged... 
[75]Stretch. That's a good one. 
[76]Yeah, no, I get it... 
[77]You gentlemen consider yourselves to be soldiers or businessmen?
dialogues.Wade:
[1]"Max" is catch-all for exactly what you've been accused of. Terminology's been around since the 50's. 
[2]I believe you. 
[3]You gave me the nod.

[6]The Company's with you on this? 
[7]I don't. Just want to make sure everyone gets paid.

[9]I was born in Quebec.

[11]Let's go.
